result.execSummary:
The defendant David W. Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David W. Adams in court with attorney Shari L Post. Defendant David W. Adams in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:13 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Court and both counsel have received a copy of the PSI.  
Atty Post states corrections. 

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Post makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  
Count 2 -
Serve determinate sentence of 4 years with 2 years initial confinement followed by 2 years extended supervision, consecutive to any sentence he is currently serving. 
Not eligible for Substance Abuse or Challenge Incarceration Programs. 
Conditions of Extended Supervision: 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with any assessments, treatment or program deemed appropriate by COMPAS or DOC. 
Sign releases of information forms as requested by DOC. 
Pay all court ordered financial obligations including costs and DNA surcharge.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or combination for fulltime.
Provide DNA sample if not already completed. 

Court advises post-conviction relief.
from the mother of the defendant dated 02/22/17 **cc:  Atty Shari Post and ADA D Knaapen

Defendant David W. Adams in court with attorney Shari L Post. Defendant David W. Adams in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
ADA Knaapen is requesting a PSI in this matter.
Attorney Post concurs with PSI request.
Court informs defendant of Constitutional Rights.
Court advises defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Defendant plea: Count 2: No Contest
Court questions Attorney Post.
Court questions defendant regarding plea.
Court finds Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently made & finds freely & voluntarily waived rights.
Parties stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Counts 1 & 3 are dismissed and read in.
BY THE COURT: Court order a PSI Report.
PSI to be delivered to all parties by 10 days prior to sentencing hearing.
Bond is Revoked and remanded to the Sheriff's Dept.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 10, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
